t: Jeremiah 9
A Lament over Zion
Oh*pn that my head were waters And*ln my eyes a fountain of tears, That*ln I might weep day and night For*ln the slain of the daughter of my people!
Oh*ln that I had in the desert A*ln wayfarers’ lodging place; That*ln I might leave my people And*ln go from them! For*ln all of them are adulterers, An*ln assembly of treacherous men.
“They*ln bend their tongue like*i their bow; Lies*ln and not truth prevail in the land; For*ln they proceed from evil to evil, And*ln they do not know Me,” declares the Lord.*s
“Let*ln everyone be on guard against his neighbor, And*ln do not trust any brother; Because*ln every brother deals craftily, And*ln every neighbor goes about as a slanderer.
Everyone*ln deceives his neighbor And*ln does not speak the truth, They*ln have taught their tongue to speak lies; They*ln weary themselves committing iniquity.
Your*ln dwelling is in the midst of deceit; Through*ln deceit they refuse to know Me,” declares the Lord.*s
Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts, “Behold,*pn I will refine them and assay them; For*ln what else*i can I do, because of the daughter of My people?
Their*ln tongue is a deadly arrow; It*ln speaks deceit; With*ln his mouth one speaks peace to his neighbor, But*ln inwardly he sets an ambush for him.
Shall*ln I not punish them for these things?” declares the Lord.*s “On*ln a nation such as this Shall*ln I not avenge Myself?

“For*ln the mountains I will take up a weeping and wailing, And*ln for the pastures of the wilderness a dirge, Because*ln they are laid waste so that no one passes through, And*ln the lowing of the cattle is not heard; Both*ln the birds of the sky and the beasts have fled; they are gone.
I*ln will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, A*ln haunt of jackals; And*ln I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”

Who*p is the wise man that may understand this? And who*i is*i he to whom the mouth of the Lord*s has spoken, that he may declare it? Why is the land ruined, laid waste like a desert, so that no one passes through?
The Lord*s said, “Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not obeyed My voice nor walked according to it,
but have walked after the stubbornness of their heart and after the Baals, as their fathers taught them,”
therefore thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel, “behold, I will feed them, this people, with wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink.
I will scatter them among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them until I have annihilated them.”
Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts, “Consider*pn and call for the mourning women, that they may come; And*ln send for the wailing women, that they may come!
Let*ln them make haste and take up a wailing for us, That*ln our eyes may shed tears And*ln our eyelids flow with water.
For*ln a voice of wailing is heard from Zion, ‘How*ln are we ruined! We*ln are put to great shame, For*ln we have left the land, Because*ln they have cast down our dwellings.’ ”
Now*ln hear the word of the Lord,*s O you women, And*ln let your ear receive the word of His mouth; Teach*ln your daughters wailing, And*ln everyone her neighbor a dirge.
For*ln death has come up through our windows; It*ln has entered our palaces To*ln cut off the children from the streets, The*ln young men from the town squares.
Speak,*ln “Thus says the Lord,*s ‘The*ln corpses of men will fall like dung on the open field, And*ln like the sheaf after the reaper, But*ln no one will gather them.’ ”*i
Thus*p says the Lord,*s “Let not a wise man boast of his wisdom, and let not the mighty man boast of his might, let not a rich man boast of his riches;

but let him who boasts boast of this, that he understands and knows Me, that I am the Lord*s who exercises lovingkindness, justice and righteousness on earth; for I delight in these things,” declares the Lord.*s
“Behold,*p the days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “that I will punish all who are circumcised and yet uncircumcised—

Egypt and Judah, and Edom and the sons of Ammon, and Moab and all those inhabiting the desert who clip the hair on their temples; for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised of heart.”
